intro: Oxybasis glauca, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its distinctive blue to purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and open habitats. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Oxybasis glauca is also known for its ability to thrive in arid environments, making it an important component of desert ecosystems.
